teaser: The European Union has turned a nose up at American cheese-makers. They feel that American made cheeses don’t even deserve to share the style names of European cheeses and that producing knock-offs of Italian Parmesan, Greek Feta, or French Gruyere is damaging European businesses in the market. Erin McCann, assistant news editor of The Guardian […]
title: Cheesy International Incidents

description: The European Union has turned a nose up at American cheese-makers. contentencoded:
The European Union has turned a nose up at American cheese-makers. They feel that American made cheeses don’t even deserve to share the style names of European cheeses and that producing knock-offs of Italian Parmesan, Greek Feta, or French Gruyere is damaging European businesses in the market.


Erin McCann, assistant news editor of The Guardian US , helps us avoid a delicious trade war.
